course_description: Covers current debates on the workings of the aggregate economy, including unemployment, inflation, economic growth, the national debt, financial markets, money and the banking system, and international trade.
prerequisites: ECON 101 or ECON_OX 101 or FIN 201 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
